intro: Heteropsis rimbachii, commonly known as the Rimbach's heteropsis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. It has small, hairy leaves and produces pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
